did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: England : Documents,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] England : Documents, M0415, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Summary: A miscellaneous collection of English documents form many sources, arranged in chronological order according to the dates of the documents.
Primarily in English; some in Latin.

did.unittitle: Deed of approximately 9 acres of land in Dodyngton, from Thomas Ady of Dodyngton to Robert John. In Latin, with seal. Melease, Kent county. 10 October 1461.
Legal document, with names of Margaret Barnes and John Cooke in text. In Latin, with 3 seals. Kent. 4 July 1560.
Indenture between George Peryont, Phillip Peryont and Edward Cason. The sum of 5,000 pounds is paid in exchange for lands. With 2 seals. 30 September 1606.
Indenture between Anne and Phillip Spurlinge of Edworth and William Affrynson, involves periodic payments for lands. With seal. 30 April 1609.
Indenture of Edward Thurston of Edworth farms, a mortgage of lands. 20 March 1610.
Indenture between Thomas Turner and Edward Thurston of Edworth in Bedford county. Turner is to pay 100 pounds for the administration of lands. 7 December 1615.
Indenture between Thomas Turner and John Amys. In Latin, on vellum. 1 June 1619.
Signed receipt acknowledging full repayment of a loan of 300 pounds, repaid by Richard Peter of Luton to Henry Denham of London. With seal. 23 October 1623.
Indenture of Richard Shiydham [?] to Thomas Snelling. 22 March 1625.
Final agreement. 1628.
Indenture. Assignment of estate by Nicholas Baron of Tidworth in Wiltshire county and Thomas [Sterkeley?]. With seal. 16 November 1631.
Mortgage between Thomas [Weeth?] student at Pembrook Hall, University of Cambridge, and John Leming. 25 October 1653.
Assignment of an annuity of 25 pounds from George Hoster of Gillingham in Suffolk county, yeoman, to Mr. Sandcroft and George Barrett. With seal. 10 May 1661.
Indenture. Transfer of lands in Denford, Northamptonshire, from William Mace alias Mason, citizen and turner of London, to William Pufford, father of Mace's wife Anne. 19 September 1662.
Deed between Richard Rowley of Priddy in Somerset county, yeoman, and James Tucker of Shepton Mallet, clothier. With seal. Somerset. 23 March 1666.
[Possibly] appointments of attorney. In English, German and Latin. One leaf, series of statements dated 1694-1712.

Indenture between James Shade, cooper, of Newmarket in Cambridge county and William Mayor the Elder of Soham in Cambridge county. Sale of land and buildings in Newmarket by Mayor to Shade. 20 November 1709.Endorsement on verso by James Shade. 22 November 1709.Notes of receipt of interest. November, 1712.
Foot of fine. In Latin, Bastarda Anglicana script on vellum. Ca. 1714-1729.
British legal document. In Latin, bearing stamp. 1725.
Deed of land by William Amory, signed by H.M. Dolphin Howard, of the Manor of Longdon. Bearing stamp. 15 October 1741.
Marriage license, with seal, parish of Highgate in Middlesex county, signed by George Gibson and Tho. Potter. With seal. 19 February 1749.
Indenture exchange deed of lands in Alno, Yorkshire, by Richard Flawith to Thomas Mason. With seal and tax stamps. 19 October 1756.

Memorial of an indenture. William Lyster of the parish of St. George Bloomsbury, carpenter, grants lands at Paddington to Frederick Atherton Hindley of the parish of St. James Westminster, esquire, for a term of 99 years. With seal. 3 January 1763.

Indenture. Sale of lands in Cambridge county by John Edwards of Newmarket in Suffolk county, stone mason, to John Chambers of Soham in Cambridge county, shopkeeper, and Christopher Kent, victualler. With seal. 21 April 1766.

Announcement of an inquisition of Thomas Wigan, Jr., found to be in arrears for his debt of 50,000 pounds to Robert Albion Cox and William Merle, fraudulently promised. Guildhall, Westminster in Middlesex. 8 June 1787.An attached document shows settlement of the suit for 900 pounds. With tax stamps.

Indenture. John Harding of Weston in Chester county, miller, and Thomas Joynson of Balterley in Stafford county, butcher, sell to Obadiah Brandreth of Middlewich in Chester county a farm in Balterley, in the parish of Barthemley, county of Stafford. With seal and tax stamps. 2 August 1799.
Indenture. Assignment of the lease of a house and premises situated at No. 2 Hanway Street, Oxford in Middlesex county, by Harriet Draper to Sarah Helen Sherrin. 23 Oct. 1871.
Indenture. Two fragments. n.d.
